Home_page.Home Text: Welcome to SEED! The corona pandemic has uncovered a number of systemic inequalities with regard to education and access to learning opportunities. Across countries and settings in the EU, the necessity to resort to the digital sphere with learning has shown that it is not equally possible for all members of a society to follow suit. Particularly vulnerable groups, including people with a migration background, people with a refugee background, or non-native speakers, who were already having a difficult experience before. These groups have now been even more strongly left behind in terms of education.
Home_page.paragraph: Working with social workers as well as the newly emerged profession of cultural mediators who is acting as a bridge towards municipalities and local educational institutions, such as schools, and extending their personal reach-out towards the digital sphere by means of chatbots, the SEEDS project proposes a combination of social and digital outreach to mitigate this effect. Needed learning contents will be communicated in a new way by means of chatbots, where municipalities and educational institutions can create learning materials in a pre-defined processes, and cultural mediators, social workers, or individual learners themselves can access the learning material that teachers created, to enhance the learners’ educational experience.

user_profile.profile_text: Here, you can edit your profile, update your information, and create new learning content for students here. Please click the button below to start the content creation process. Use the fields on the left, to edit your information. about.about_text: The corona pandemic has uncovered a number of systemic inequalities with regard to education and access to learning opportunities. Across countries and settings in the EU, the necessity to resort to the digital sphere with learning has shown that it is not equally possible for all members of a society to follow suit. Particularly vulnerable groups, including people with a migration background, people with a refugee background, or non-native speakers, who were already having a difficult experience before. These groups have now been even more strongly left behind in terms of education. Working with social workers as well as the newly emerged profession of cultural mediators who is acting as a bridge towards municipalities and local educational institutions, such as schools, and extending their personal reach-out towards the digital sphere by means of chatbots, the SEEDS project proposes a combination of social and digital outreach to mitigate this effect. Needed learning contents will be communicated in a new way by means of chatbots, where municipalities and educational institutions can create learning materials in a pre-defined processes, and cultural mediators, social workers, or individual learners themselves can access the learning material that teachers created, to enhance the learners’ educational experience.

faq.q_how_to_contact: How can I contact the team?
faq.q_is_project_running: Is the project still running or finished?
faq.q_are_project_results_open: Are the outcomes of the project openly accessible?
faq.q_where_are_project_results: Where can I find the results of the project?
faq.a_what_is_seeds: SEEDS is a project for supporting learning and education on the fringe of the digital sphere. Due to the lack of access to educational institutions and little or no equipment (Tablets, or Laptops and PCs) with necessary digital technologies, young people found it difficult to follow classes. ICT and above all the smartphone can be used here to mitigate this deficit. The needs and challenges of the target group must be taken into account (i.e. no up-to-date smartphones with outdated software). Our idea is to communicate learning content to vulnerable people in a new way by using chat bots.
faq.a_who_is_funding_seeds: SEEDS is funded by: Erasmus+ Strategic Partnership
faq.a_what_is_project_website: You can visit us on: https://seeds.wineme.wiwi.uni-siegen.de
faq.a_how_to_contact: You can contact us using our email: seeds.members@listserv.dfn.de
faq.a_who_are_project_partners: SEEDS is a collaboration among 4 partners: 1) University of Siegen, Institute of Knowledge Based Systems and Knowledge Management. 2)University of Siegen, Chair of Information Systems and New Media. 3) University of Alicante. 4) Open Lab Athens
faq.a_is_project_running: The project's duration is two years, between 2021-2023.
faq.a_are_project_results_open: All SEEDS project results are open-access and available on the project's website and repositories
faq.a_where_are_project_results: You can find the project's results and repository links on the project's website.
